items.content_html: This PR updates and corrects version values for Opera and Opera Android for the SpeechRecognitionErrorEvent API. This sets Opera to mirror from upstream.

items.content_html:
This PR updates and corrects version values for Safari (Desktop and iOS/iPadOS) for the WEBGL_compressed_texture_astc API. The data comes from a commit in the browser's source code, mapped to a version number using available tooling or via the commit timestamp.

Commit: WebKit/WebKit@6d5219c

This PR updates and corrects version values for Safari (Desktop and iOS/iPadOS) for the TouchList API. The data comes from the mdn-bcd-collector project (v10.0.3).

Check out the collector's guide on how to review this PR.

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/TouchList

Additional Notes: (Discussed during a 1-on-1 ï¿½call with Florian. The original data comes from Apple's developer docs which has incorrect version numbers. Also, the Touch interface itself isn't supported in Safari Desktop.

items.content_html: This PR updates and corrects version values for Firefox and Firefox Android for the Touch API. During testing, it was found that this interface is only available if there is hardware touch support (as per dom.w3c_touch_events.enabled being set to 2 (auto-detect) in Windows and Linux).
items.title: Update Firefox data for Touch API

items.content_html:
This PR removes the Request.navigate_mode member of the Request API from BCD. No browser supports construction of a request when mode is set to navigate.

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/Request/Request/navigate_mode
items.title: Remove api.Request.Request.navigate_mode from BCD

items.content_html:
Summary

This adds the new customElements.getName() method.

Test results and supporting details

It is currently being specified spec, PR.

Related issues

See above, plus:

Safari TP has it (see WebKit/WebKit#13053).
Chrome has an intent to ship for 117 (https://chromestatus.com/feature/5199783177748480)
Firefox has a patch https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D181646
items.title: add customelements getname method

items.content_html:
Summary

Hah, it's another CSS scroll-driven animations BCD PR ;-)

So, previously in the corresponding content update (mdn/content#27075) I had a couple of pages that listed the standard scroll axis values alongside the deprecated non-logical axis values, which are still supported in Firefox as the implementation is a bit out of date.

I ended up removing the deprecated values from the content, as it seemed a bit strange to list them there. This PR adds notes to the BCD to cover that value support instead, as it seemed like a better place to include it.

Test results and supporting details

Related issues
items.title: Add notes on Firefox proprietary scroll axis values

items.content_html: So this feels a little weird but it updates the console data according to the discussion in #20114.
items.title: Mark console functions _static

items.content_html:
FF115 adds support for Sec-Purpose header in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1836328.

The other browsers are not supported according to https://wpt.fyi/results/preload/prefetch-headers.https.html?label=experimental&label=master&aligned in Chrome 116, Safari 172.

Sec-Purpose: prefetch is the new way to indicate a request is a prefetch request. In Firefox it replaces X-moz: prefetch and in Chromium it will replace Purpose: prefetch. I want to avoid tracking that behaviour in BCD if you are OK with it. Instead I have put mention of those in the notes. At some point fairly soon we'll have a situation where all prefetch behaviour is the same.
If you strongly disagree I can add records for those too. Mostly I don't want to try work out when they were first added, since it would have been a very very long time ago, and hard to test.

Related docs work can be tracked in mdn/content#27171
items.title: FF115 Add Sec-Purpose HTTP header

items.content_html:
This PR fixes #18777 by stripping out the patch versions in the NodeJS releases, leaving only major and minor release numbers. This follows our conventions better.

Note: this will fail CI for the time being as I have only modified the browsers.json as a proof-of-concept. If this PR is approved, I will then make the appropriate changes to the remaining files.
items.title: Remove patch versions from NodeJS releases

items.content_html:
Summary

This PR updates and corrects version value for Deno for caches object and CacheStorage interface. The data comes from the Deno Runtime APIs document.

Test results and supporting details

I couldn't make the test on Deno 1.26.0. But I've tested the caches object and methods from CacheStorage interface in Deno 1.34.4 and can confirm it does work.

Supporting details
  • Deno Runtime APIs document

Related issues

None
items.title: Update deno data for Cache API

items.content_html:
Summary

Added the auto value to the animation-duration, in order to show support for this value that which was proposed as part of [https://drafts.csswg.org/css-animations-2/#propdef-animation-duration](CSS Animations Level 2), this way users can easily see where this value has been support and from when.

Test results and supporting details

Currently only supported in Chrome 115.

Related issues

Associated MDN Content issues: 26685 & 26687
Associated Bugzilla bugs: 1808410 & 1737920

Associated MDN Content PR - 27075
items.title: 26685 26687 view progress timelines

items.content_html:
Summary

Addresses the documentation needs of Bug 1606862 Make devtools an optional permission.

No reference found to this permission in the Chrome documentation e.g. https://developer.chrome.com/docs/extensions/mv3/declare_permissions/#permissions or https://developer.chrome.com/docs/extensions/reference/devtools_inspectedWindow/

Confirmed as included in Safari on this page: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/safariservices/safari_web_extensions/adding_a_web_development_tool_to_safari_web_inspector#3966899
items.title: devtools as optional permission
